p: Therefore, the activation of these enzymes stimulates intracellular signals (NFkB, p38 or MAPKs, which modify the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines, for example, interleukin 1 beta (IL1b), interleukin 6 (IL6), and tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-Î±) adhesion proteins and chemokines, leading to stimulation and activation of immune cells [ 122]. Thus, the metabolites of COX-2 are involved in inflammatory disorders. Studies indicate that inhibition of COX-2 or soluble epoxidehydrolase is beneficial for inflammation [ 114, 139, 140, 141, 142, 143, 144, 145, 146, 147].
